sen.j: 京都ラーメン（きょうとラーメン）とは、日本の京都府（主に京都市以南）で販売され食べられているラーメンを雑誌や書籍で紹介する場合に用いられる総称。
sen.e: Kyoto ramen is a generic name of ramen sold and eaten in Kyoto Prefecture, Japan (mainly in Kyoto City and southern areas) when introduced in Magazines and books.

sen.e: There are Kyo-style ramen produced based on an image of Kyoto and Kyoto-style ramen not deriving from Kyoto, which are mainly sold and eaten in other area than Kyoto.

Kyo-style ramen, which is a style of ramen that has been created based on the image of Kyoto, and Kyoto-style ramen, which does not have its origins in Kyoto, are two styles of ramen that share a similar name to Kyoto ramen but are mainly sold and eaten in areas other than Kyoto.
sen.cmt: The Japanese does not mention that these two styles of ramen have a similar name to Kyoto ramen (because this is obvious to a Japanese speaker from the kanji), but I don't think this would necessarily be clear to a native speaker of English with little knowledge of Japan/Japanese so I added this.
